title: Quiz 2: Instrument Processing & Waste Disposal
description: Test your knowledge on decontamination calculations, sterilization methods, and waste segregation.

questions.question: What is the correct formula to calculate the parts of water needed to dilute liquid bleach?

richContent.content: \text{Total Parts} = \left( \frac{\% \text{ Chlorine in bleach}}{\% \text{ Chlorine desired}} \right) - 1

questions.explanation: The formula is [% Chlorine in liquid bleach / % Chlorine desired] - 1.
questions.hint: Divide the concentrate by the desired strength, then subtract 1.

questions.question: If you have 3.5% liquid bleach and need a 0.5% solution, how many parts of water do you add to 1 part bleach?
Arrange the steps of processing instruments in the correct order:
questions.explanation: Decontamination makes items safe to touch -> Cleaning removes organic matter -> Sterilization kills all microbes.
questions.hint: Make it safe to touch first, then clean it.

questions.question: How long should instruments soak in 0.5% chlorine solution for decontamination?
questions.explanation: Instruments should soak for 10 minutes immediately after use.

questions.question: Match the waste type with the appropriate disposal container/method:
questions.explanation: Sharps go in puncture-proof boxes; Infectious waste in Red; General in Black; Liquids down sluice/drain.

questions.question: Sterilization kills all micro-organisms including bacterial endospores, whereas High Level Disinfection (HLD) does not reliably kill all endospores.
questions.explanation: Sterilization eliminates all forms of life including spores. HLD eliminates all microorganisms but not necessarily large numbers of bacterial spores.
questions.hint: Think about the difference between 'Sterile' and 'Disinfected'.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid methods for High Level Disinfection (HLD)? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Soaking in chemicals (e.g., Chlorine/Glutaraldehyde) for 20 minutes

questions.explanation: Boiling, Chemical soak (20 mins), and Steaming are HLD methods. Autoclaving is a Sterilization method.

questions.question: Sharps disposal containers should be disposed of when they are ___BLANK___ full.
questions.explanation: Dispose of sharps containers when they are three-quarters full to prevent injury from overfilling.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a safe practice for sharps disposal?

options.text: Do not recap needles by hand
Bend or break needles before disposal
Use the single-hand scoop method if recapping is necessary
Dispose of syringe and needle as a unit

questions.explanation: You should NEVER bend or break needles as this increases the risk of accidental injury and aerosolization of pathogens.
questions.hint: Which action requires manipulating the sharp part?

questions.question: Instruments sterilized by autoclaving should be removed immediately while still wet to prevent contamination.
questions.explanation: Packs/items should be left in the autoclave until they dry completely. Wet packs can wick bacteria from the environment.
questions.hint: Moisture can be a bridge for bacteria.
